conversation.text: Hello there! Today's recipe is Rosemary garlic chicken legs. Are you ready to begin?
Of course!
Very good! So before begin to season the chicken, it's best to preheat the oven to 350 degrees so the oven is nice and hot for when we bake the chicken!
evidence: start preheating it when you are ready to start seasoning the chicken.

conversation.text: No problem. The oven is on.

Perfect. So let's prepare the chicken legs first by first washing them. Run cool water over the legs and wash thoroughly while removing dangling pieces of fat or skin. After washing, pat the chicken dry with some paper towels and set them aside!
evidence: wash them thoroughly under cool, running water
After you have washed the meat, dry the meat with paper towels

conversation.text: What should I do after it?

Now you can prepare the ingredients to coat the chicken. In one pan, put some flour. In a second pan, put eggs and milk. And in the third and last pan, combine rosemary, garlic, breadcrumbs, salt, and pepper.
evidence: Place the flour in a shallow pan
Combine the eggs and milk in a separate pan
Combine the rosemary, garlic, breadcrumbs, and salt and pepper in a third shallow pan.

conversation.text: That's too complicated. Can I mix all the ingredients together in one pan?
That's not advisable. Let's break it down and make it easier for you. Grab one pan and add flour. Are you ready to move on to the second pan?
evidence: Place the flour in a shallow pan

conversation.text: Never mind, I just thought it is not necessary to have three pans. What do I do after all the three pans are ready?

It may seem to be a hassle but if you want your chicken properly seasoned then it is absolutely necessary. Now we can begin coating the chicken. Using tongs, coat the chicken in the flour, then egg mixture, and then finally the rosemary/garlic mixture. How's it looking?
evidence: Using a pair of tongs, coat each piece of chicken, one at a time.
First coat each piece in the flour, then the egg mixture, and then the rosemary garlic mixture

conversation.text: It has been coated evenly.

Tremendous. Now place your coated chicken in a baking pan coated in olive oil. Then put the chicken in the oven and cook for about 30 minutes. You will know your chicken is done when it's sizzling and crispy or when the chicken's internal temperature reachs 180 degrees.
evidence: Place the coated pieces of chicken in a glass or metal baking pan coated in olive oil
The chicken is finished when it's sizzling and crispy, or when its internal temperature reaches 180 degrees

conversation.text: I don't have a thermometer. I found it's turning brown and crispy outside but the inside is still not ready. What should I do?
If the inside is still not ready then you will need to put it back into the oven and continue baking it until it is ready,
evidence: The chicken is finished when it's sizzling and crispy, or when its internal temperature reaches 180 degrees

conversation.text: Okay, I'll check it.
Sounds good! How does your chicken look now?
Just as before.
Okay, then you will need to continue cooking your chicken until it's done.
How do I know it's done?
The chicken should be ready when it's sizzling and crispy or when it's internal temperature reads 180 degrees. How does it look now?
evidence: The chicken is finished when it's sizzling and crispy, or when its internal temperature reaches 180 degrees

conversation.text: It should be ready now.
Great, now we can serve the chicken! Feel free to serve with whatever side dishes you like. Green beans and wild rice may a terrific choice!
evidence: Serve with french green beans and wild rice, or the side dishes of your choice

recipe.title: How to Make Rosemary Garlic Chicken Legs

procedure.description: To make sure that your oven is hot and ready to bake the chicken, start preheating it when you are ready to start seasoning the chicken.

Remove the legs from the package and wash them thoroughly under cool, running water. Remove dangling pieces of fat or skin. After you have washed the meat, dry the meat with paper towels. This will help the flavors cling to the meat, and allow the skin to get crispy when cooked. Set the meat on a plate until you are ready to move on to the next step.
Place the flour in a shallow pan. Combine the eggs and milk in a separate pan. Combine the rosemary, garlic, breadcrumbs, and salt and pepper in a third shallow pan.

Using a pair of tongs, coat each piece of chicken, one at a time. First coat each piece in the flour, then the egg mixture, and then the rosemary garlic mixture. Place the coated pieces of chicken in a glass or metal baking pan coated in olive oil.
The chicken is finished when it's sizzling and crispy, or when its internal temperature reaches 180 degrees. Use a meat thermometer to check the temperature.
Serve with french green beans and wild rice, or the side dishes of your choice.
